meanings.definition: To make unable or unfit; deprive of capability or effectiveness
meanings.sent1: The broken leg will disable him from running in the race.
meanings.sent2: The virus can disable a computer system if not properly protected.
meanings.sent3: Trying to play soccer with a deflated ball would disable the game.
meanings.sent4: Lack of sleep can disable your ability to concentrate on tasks.
meanings.sent5: A sudden power outage can disable all electronic devices in the house.

meanings.definition: To impair the physical or mental abilities of; make incapable or unfit
meanings.sent1: The loud noise could disable his hearing temporarily.
meanings.sent2: A strong blow to the head can disable a person's sense of balance.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much candy might disable your energy levels later on.
meanings.sent4: The fog was so thick it seemed to disable the driver's visibility.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout session nearly disabled her muscles for days.
